intro: Nematopyxis japonica, commonly known as the Japanese nematocarp, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and compound leaves that are often divided into several narrow segments. Its small, yellowish-green flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Nematopyxis japonica is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks.
